reactor.io.net

Class AbstractNetChannel<IN,OUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.io.net.AbstractNetChannel<IN,OUT>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetChannel<IN,OUT>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NettyNetChannel, ZeroMQNetChannel

    public abstract class AbstractNetChannel<IN,OUT>
extends Object
implements NetChannel<IN,OUT>
    An abstract NetChannel implementation that handles the basic interaction and Stream and Consumer handling.
    Author:
    Jon Brisbin, Stephane Maldini

    • Nested Class Summary

      • send

        protected void send(OUT data,
                    Promise<Void> onComplete)
        Send data on this connection. The current codec (if any) will be used to encode the data to a Buffer. The given callback will be invoked when the write has completed.
        Parameters:
        data - The outgoing data.
        onComplete - The callback to invoke when the write is complete.

      • read

        public boolean read(Buffer data)
        Performing necessary decoding on the data and notify the internal EventBus of any results.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to decode.
        Returns:
        true if any more data is remaining to be consumed in the given Buffer, false otherwise.

        public void notifyRead(Object obj)

      • write

        protected void write(Buffer data,
                     Promise<Void> onComplete,
                     boolean flush)
        Subclasses must implement this method to perform the actual IO of writing data to the connection.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to write, as a Buffer.
        onComplete - The callback to invoke when the write is complete.

      • write

        protected abstract void write(ByteBuffer data,
                              Promise<Void> onComplete,
                              boolean flush)
        Subclasses must implement this method to perform the actual IO of writing data to the connection.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to write.
        onComplete - The callback to invoke when the write is complete.
        flush - whether to flush the underlying IO channel
